00040 
00041 #ifndef AVS_AES_H_
00042 #define AVS_AES_H_
00043 
00044 /**
00045  * \section Configuration
00046  * Configuration items for the Avalon Slave component 
00047  * change them or define them elsewhere
00048  */
00049 #ifndef KEYWORDS
00050 /** 
00051  * Keylength 256 Bit AES 
00052 */
00053 #define KEYWORDS        8
00054 #endif  /*  KEYWORDS  */
00055 
00056 #ifndef AES_BASEADDR
00057 /** 
00058  * base address of the Avalon Slave component in memory map 
00059 */
00060 #define AES_BASEADDR    0x40000 
00061 #endif /* AES_BASEADDR */
00062 
00063 
00064 /**
00065  * \section Constants
00066  * Constants no need to change them!
00067  */
00068 /** memory offset for key  DON'T CHANGE!  */
00069 #define KEY_ADDR        AES_BASEADDR+0x00
00070 /** memory offset of payload   DON'T CHANGE!*/
00071 #define DATA_ADDR       AES_BASEADDR+0x08
00072 /** memory offset of result   DON'T CHANGE! */
00073 #define RESULT_ADDR     AES_BASEADDR+0x10
00074 /** memory offset for control word   DON'T CHANGE! */
00075 #define AESCTRLWD       AES_BASEADDR+0x18 
00076 
00077 /**
00078  * \brief object storing addresses for this Avalon AES slave 
00079  * might be useful in case there are more attached, also for convinience
00080  */
00081 typedef struct{
00082      /** 
00083       * \brief pointer "KEY" field in memory mapping      
00084     */
00085     volatile unsigned int* key;
00086      /** 
00087      * \brief pointer "data" field in memory mapping
00088      * used for both decryption and encryption    
00089      */
00090     volatile unsigned int* payload;
00091      /** 
00092       * \brief pointer "RESULT" field in memory mapping   
00093      */
00094     volatile unsigned int* result;
00095      /** 
00096       * \brief pointer to control word  
00097     */
00098     volatile unsigned int* control; 
00099 } avs_aes_handle;
00100 
00101 /**
00102  * \section functions 
00103  **/
00104 
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * \brief setup the context to be used later.
00108  * initializes the pointers to the correct memory locations
00109  * \param context : struct grouping address information 
00110  */
00111 void avs_aes_init(avs_aes_handle* context);
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * \brief setup the context to be used later.
00115  * initializes the pointers to the correct memory locations
00116  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00117  * \param key user key to load
00118  */
00119 void avs_aes_setKey(avs_aes_handle* context, unsigned int* key);
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * \brief loads payload for processing to the core
00123  * basically memcopy...
00124  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00125  * \param payload user data to be processed
00126  */
00127 void avs_aes_setPayload(avs_aes_handle* context, unsigned int* payload);
00128 
00129 /**
00130  * \brief set the KEY_VALID flag in the control word
00131  * used to signal the completion of writing the key ( \ref avs_aes_setKey )
00132  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00133  */
00134 void avs_aes_setKeyvalid(avs_aes_handle* context);
00135 
00136 /**
00137  * \brief set the ENCRYPT flag in the control word
00138  * start encryption of (hopefully) previously loaded payload 
00139  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00140  */
00141 void avs_aes_encrypt(avs_aes_handle* context);
00142 
00143 /**
00144  * \brief set the DECRYPT flag in the control word
00145  * start encryption of (hopefully) previously loaded payload 
00146  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00147  */
00148 void avs_aes_decrypt( avs_aes_handle* context);
00149 
00150 /**
00151  * \brief checks the COMPLETED flag
00152  * can be used for ugly polling the slave if IRQs are not used
00153  * \param context  struct grouping address information 
00154  * \return 1 if still computing 0 if done.
00155  */
00156 int avs_aes_isBusy(avs_aes_handle* context);
00157 
00158 
00159 #endif /*AVS_AES_H_*/
